title: TypoTechnica 2007 Talks
content: Thomas Phinney's new blog entry about [TypoTechnica 2007 Talks](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016090758/http:/blogs.adobe.com/typblography/2007/05/typotechnica_2007.html#more). I didn't see a link on Typophile so far and found it only now, a week after it has been posted. Thanks a lot!
author: k.l.

comments.content:
All thanks to Thomas for collecting great material. But now, don't disturb. I'm reading.  :)

Don't forget: Mr Blokland's earlier link to the [OpenType Status 2007](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016090758/http:/typophile.com/node/33122#comment-200593) presentation.

[Ha, Paul Hunt made a [wiki entry](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016090758/http:/typophile.com/node/34134) already.]

![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016090758im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Adobe_4316.gif)
  
Yeah, thanks for mentioning this. I hadn't noticed it was posted. I also like seeing the old logo on the first slide. It kind of says, "Hey, we've been doing this for awhile."

\> _I also like seeing the old logo on the first slide._

That's the cover of a binder that is lying around, which used to document all the in-house tools and processes. I thought it was cool, and so decided to take a picture of it for using in the cover slide. I'm glad you like it :^)

\> _It kind of says, “Hey, we’ve been doing this for awhile.”_

Yep, Type at Adobe goes as far back as when the company debuted, which was about 25 years ago. And there are still people around from those early ages, like [David Lemon](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016090758/http:/typophile.com/wiki/David%20Lemon) and [Robert Slimbach](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016090758/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Robert%20Slimbach), who have been working in the Type Department for more that 20 years each.

BTW, [Thomas](http://web.archive.org/web/20131016090758/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Thomas%20Phinney) is celebrating his 10th anniversary at Adobe. So please join me in a big round of applause. Congratulations Thomas, wish you stay 10 more year, at least!!

I'll agree to stick around another ten years if you will. :)

T
